w3af-run.w3af-version: w3af - Web Application Attack and Audit Framework Version: 1.7.6 Revision: unknown Distribution: Kali Linux Rolling Branch: unknown Local changes: No Author: Andres Riancho and the w3af team.

vulnerability.name: Omitted server header
vulnerability.description: The remote HTTP Server omitted the "server" header in its response.

vulnerability.name: Non existent methods default to GET
vulnerability.description: The remote Web server has a custom configuration, in which any not implemented methods that are invoked are defaulted to GET instead of returning a "Not Implemented" response.

vulnerability.name: No DNS wildcard
vulnerability.description: The target site has NO DNS wildcard, and the contents of "http://bjqhzd.com/" differ from the contents of "http://mail.bjqhzd.com/".

vulnerability.name: Strange HTTP response code
vulnerability.description: The remote web server sent 18 HTTP responses with the uncommon response status code 400 using "Bad Request" as message. The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon status code are: - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/tzqOR.html - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/invoker\JMXInvokerServlet - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/ - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/invoker/DEpus - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/favicon.ico - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/PLVCO - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/invoker/ - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/_vti_inf.html - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/server-status - http://mail.bjqhzd.com/invoker/JMXInvokerServlet
vulnerability.long-description: The server responded with a strange HTTP status code. This is a non-issue however exotic HTTP response status codes can provide useful insights into the behavior of the web application and assist with the information security analysis.
vulnerability.fix-guidance: Manually inspect the HTTP response status code and body

vulnerability.name: Active filter detected
vulnerability.description: The remote network has an active filter. IMPORTANT: The result of all the other plugins will be inaccurate, web applications could be vulnerable but "protected" by the active filter.

vulnerability.name: HTTP traceroute
vulnerability.description: The routes to the target's HTTP and HTTPS ports are the same: 0 192.168.16.2 1 101.6.215.16

vulnerability.name: JMX Invoker enabled without Auth
vulnerability.description: JMX Invoker enables attackers to send any JMX command to JBoss AS

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "webservice". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "webservice" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "webservice.mail.bjqhzd.com". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "webservice.mail.bjqhzd.com" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "webservice.bjqhzd". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "webservice.bjqhzd" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "webservice.bjqhzd.com". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "webservice.bjqhzd.com" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "private.bjqhzd". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "private.bjqhzd" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Virtual host identified
vulnerability.description: Found a new virtual host at the target web server, the virtual host name is: "public.bjqhzd". To access this site you might need to change your DNS resolution settings in order to point "public.bjqhzd" to the IP address of "mail.bjqhzd.com".

vulnerability.name: Operating system
vulnerability.description: Fingerprinted this host as a Microsoft Windows system.

vulnerability.name: Webserver fingerprint
vulnerability.description: The most accurate fingerprint for this HTTP server is: "Microsoft-HTTPAPI/2.0".

vulnerability.name: Click-Jacking vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The whole target has no protection (X-Frame-Options header) against Click-Jacking attacks
vulnerability.long-description:
Clickjacking (User Interface redress attack, UI redress attack, UI redressing) is a malicious technique of tricking a Web user into clicking on something different from what the user perceives they are clicking on, thus potentially revealing confidential information or taking control of their computer while clicking on seemingly innocuous web pages.
The server didn't return an `X-Frame-Options` header which means that this website could be at risk of a clickjacking attack. The `X-Frame-Options` HTTP response header can be used to indicate whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page inside a frame or iframe. Sites can use this to avoid clickjacking attacks, by ensuring that their content is not embedded into other sites.
vulnerability.fix-guidance: Configure your web server to include an X-Frame-Options header.
